intro: Myosurus minimus, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its dense clusters of tiny, pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Myosurus minimus has heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is a short-lived perennial that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense mats in suitable habitats.
